title: ap.analysis of pdes - Linearization Navier-Stokes
body:
I am considering the classical form of the stationary Navier-Stokes equation given by $$ rac{1}{Re} (
abla v, 
abla \phi) + ((v \cdot 
abla) v, \phi) - (p, 
abla \cdot \phi) = (f,\phi);\qquad (
abla \cdot v, \xi) = 0.$$ Now, for suitable Reynolds numbers, one can treat the nonlinearity by linearization, e.g. Stokes linearization $(v^{k-1} \cdot 
abla) v^{k-1}$ or Oseen linearization $(v^{k-1} \cdot 
abla) v^k$ . My question: is it also possible to consider a linearization of the form: $(v^k \cdot 
abla) v^{k-1}$ ? ap.analysis-of-pdes navier-stokes Share Cite Improve this question Follow edited Jun 29, 2020 at 11:07 YCor 67.5k 5 5 gold badges 203 203 silver badges 301 301 bronze badges asked Jun 29, 2020 at 9:54 Frieder 11 2 2 bronze badges $\endgroup$ 2 1 $ egingroup$ I thought the Oseen approximation substitutes $v=U+\delta v$ and linearizes in $\delta v$ assuming $
abla U=0$, so $(v\cdot
abla)vightarrow (U\cdot
abla)\delta v$ without a term $(\delta v\cdot
abla)U$. $\endgroup$ Carlo Beenakker –  Carlo Beenakker 2020-06-29 10:21:45 +00:00 Commented Jun 29, 2020 at 10:21 1 $ egingroup$ Of course it is possible, but what would be the point? $\endgroup$ Michael Renardy –  Michael Renardy 2020-06-29 10:52:00 +00:00 Commented Jun 29, 2020 at 10:52 Add a comment  |  0 Sorted by: Reset to default Highest score (default) Date modified (newest first) Date created (oldest first) You must log in to answer this question.
